description: Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) privacy resources including Surveillance Self-Defense guides, Privacy Badger, and digital rights advocacy. COMPLETELY FREE access to privacy tools, guides, and resources.

bash.eff_privacy_setup:
#!/bin/bash
# EFF Privacy Tools Setup - COMPLETELY FREE!

echo "🔐 EFF Privacy Toolkit Setup (FREE!)"
echo "====================================="
echo "Date: $(date)"
echo ""

# Privacy Badger
echo "🦡 Privacy Badger Browser Extension:"
echo "   Chrome: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/privacy-badger/pkehgijcmpdhfbdbbnkijodmdjhbjlgp"
echo "   Firefox: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/privacy-badger17/"
echo "   Edge: https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/privacy-badger/mkejgcgkdlddbggjhhflekkondicpnop"
echo ""

# Cover Your Tracks
echo "🔍 Test Your Browser Privacy:"
echo "   🔗 https://coveryourtracks.eff.org/"
echo "   Tests: Fingerprinting, Tracking, Supercookies"
echo ""

# Surveillance Self-Defense
echo "🛡️ Surveillance Self-Defense Guides:"
echo "   🔗 https://ssd.eff.org/"
echo "   • Basics: Online privacy fundamentals"
echo "   • Tools: Tor, Signal, PGP, VPN guides"
echo "   • Scenarios: Journalist, activist, travel security"
echo ""

# Certbot installation
echo "🔒 Certbot SSL/TLS Setup:"
if command -v certbot &> /dev/null; then
    echo "   ✅ Certbot is installed"
    certbot --version
else
    echo "   ❌ Certbot not installed"
    echo "   Install with:"
    echo "   Ubuntu/Debian: sudo apt-get install certbot"
    echo "   CentOS/RHEL: sudo yum install certbot"
    echo "   macOS: brew install certbot"
fi
echo ""

# Additional tools
echo "🔧 Additional EFF Tools:"
echo "   • HTTPS Everywhere: Force secure connections"
echo "   • Atlas of Surveillance: Police tech database"
echo "   • Crocodile Hunter: Fake cell tower detection"
echo "   • TOSBack: Terms of Service tracking"
echo ""

# Privacy checklist
echo "✅ Privacy Checklist:"
echo "   [ ] Install Privacy Badger"
echo "   [ ] Test browser with Cover Your Tracks"
echo "   [ ] Read SSD guides for your threat model"
echo "   [ ] Enable HTTPS on your sites"
echo "   [ ] Use encrypted messaging (Signal)"
echo "   [ ] Set up password manager"
echo "   [ ] Enable 2FA everywhere"
echo "   [ ] Review privacy settings"
echo ""

# Resources
echo "📚 EFF Resources:"
echo "   📰 News: https://www.eff.org/updates"
echo "   📖 Deeplinks: https://www.eff.org/deeplinks"
echo "   🎯 Action: https://act.eff.org/"
echo "   💰 Donate: https://supporters.eff.org/donate"
echo ""

echo "📅 Setup guide generated: $(date)"

curl.get_eff_updates:
# Get EFF updates RSS feed - FREE!
curl -s 'https://www.eff.org/rss/updates.xml' | head -100
curl.test_https:
# Test HTTPS support on a domain
curl -I https://example.com 2>&1 | grep -E 'HTTP|SSL'

python.eff_privacy_tools:
import requests
import json
from datetime import datetime
import subprocess

class EFFPrivacyToolkit:
    """EFF Privacy Tools and Resources - COMPLETELY FREE!"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.base_url = 'https://www.eff.org'
        self.ssd_url = 'https://ssd.eff.org'
        self.tools = {
            'privacy_badger': 'https://privacybadger.org',
            'cover_your_tracks': 'https://coveryourtracks.eff.org',
            'https_everywhere': 'https://www.eff.org/https-everywhere'
        }
    
    def test_browser_privacy(self):
        """Test browser privacy using Cover Your Tracks"""
        print("🔍 EFF Cover Your Tracks (FREE!)\n")
        print("Test your browser's privacy protection:")
        print(f"🔗 {self.tools['cover_your_tracks']}\n")
        
        print("📊 What Cover Your Tracks Tests:")
        tests = [
            "Browser fingerprinting resistance",
            "Tracking protection effectiveness",
            "Ad blocker detection",
            "Canvas fingerprinting",
            "WebGL fingerprinting",
            "Font fingerprinting",
            "Do Not Track compliance",
            "Supercookie protection"
        ]
        
        for test in tests:
            print(f"   • {test}")
        
        print("\n💡 Privacy Recommendations:")
        print("   1. Install Privacy Badger extension")
        print("   2. Enable tracking protection in browser")
        print("   3. Use VPN or Tor for anonymity")
        print("   4. Disable third-party cookies")
        print("   5. Use privacy-focused browser (Firefox, Brave)")
        
        return self.tools['cover_your_tracks']
    
    def get_surveillance_self_defense(self, scenario='general'):
        """Get Surveillance Self-Defense guides"""
        print("🛡️ EFF Surveillance Self-Defense (FREE!)\n")
        
        scenarios = {
            'general': 'Everyday privacy protection',
            'journalist': 'Journalist and source protection',
            'activist': 'Protest and activism security',
            'academic': 'Academic and researcher privacy',
            'lgbtq': 'LGBTQ+ community safety',
            'travel': 'Border crossing and travel security'
        }
        
        print(f"📚 SSD Guide: {scenarios.get(scenario, 'General')}")
        print(f"🔗 {self.ssd_url}\n")
        
        print("📖 Available Guide Categories:")
        for key, desc in scenarios.items():
            print(f"   • {desc}")
        
        print("\n🔧 Key Privacy Tools Covered:")
        tools = [
            "Signal - Encrypted messaging",
            "Tor Browser - Anonymous browsing",
            "PGP/GPG - Email encryption",
            "Full disk encryption",
            "Password managers",
            "2FA/MFA authentication",
            "VPN services",
            "Secure file deletion"
        ]
        
        for tool in tools:
            print(f"   • {tool}")
        
        print("\n📋 Security Practices:")
        practices = [
            "Threat modeling",
            "Operational security (OpSec)",
            "Device security hardening",
            "Secure communications",
            "Safe social media usage",
            "Metadata minimization",
            "Physical security",
            "Emergency planning"
        ]
        
        for practice in practices:
            print(f"   • {practice}")
        
        return f"{self.ssd_url}/module-categories"
    
    def install_privacy_badger(self):
        """Guide for installing Privacy Badger"""
        print("🦡 Privacy Badger Installation (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("📥 Download Links:")
        browsers = {
            'Chrome': 'https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/privacy-badger/pkehgijcmpdhfbdbbnkijodmdjhbjlgp',
            'Firefox': 'https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/privacy-badger17/',
            'Edge': 'https://microsoftedge.microsoft.com/addons/detail/privacy-badger/mkejgcgkdlddbggjhhflekkondicpnop',
            'Opera': 'https://addons.opera.com/en/extensions/details/privacy-badger/'
        }
        
        for browser, url in browsers.items():
            print(f"   • {browser}: {url}")
        
        print("\n🔰 What Privacy Badger Does:")
        features = [
            "Automatically learns to block invisible trackers",
            "Stops advertisers from tracking your browsing",
            "Blocks third-party tracking cookies",
            "Prevents canvas fingerprinting",
            "Removes tracking from social media buttons",
            "Works without configuration needed",
            "Open source and transparent"
        ]
        
        for feature in features:
            print(f"   ✓ {feature}")
        
        print("\n📊 Privacy Badger Statistics:")
        print("   • 1+ million users")
        print("   • Blocks 1000s of trackers")
        print("   • No browsing history collected")
        print("   • Developed by EFF nonprofit")
        
        return self.tools['privacy_badger']
    
    def setup_certbot(self):
        """Guide for setting up Certbot for SSL/TLS"""
        print("🔐 Certbot SSL/TLS Setup (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("📦 Installation Commands:")
        install_cmds = {
            'Ubuntu/Debian': 'sudo apt-get install certbot',
            'CentOS/RHEL': 'sudo yum install certbot',
            'macOS': 'brew install certbot',
            'Docker': 'docker run -it certbot/certbot'
        }
        
        for platform, cmd in install_cmds.items():
            print(f"   {platform}:")
            print(f"   $ {cmd}\n")
        
        print("🔧 Basic Usage:")
        print("   # Obtain certificate")
        print("   $ sudo certbot certonly --webroot -w /var/www/html -d example.com\n")
        print("   # Auto-renewal")
        print("   $ sudo certbot renew --dry-run\n")
        
        print("✅ Benefits:")
        print("   • Free SSL/TLS certificates")
        print("   • Automatic renewal")
        print("   • Easy integration")
        print("   • Let's Encrypt backed")
        print("   • Industry standard security")
        
        return "https://certbot.eff.org/"
    
    def generate_privacy_report(self):
        """Generate comprehensive EFF privacy report"""
        print(f"🔐 EFF Privacy Toolkit Report (FREE!)")
        print(f"Report Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n")
        
        print("=" * 50)
        print("🛡️ SURVEILLANCE SELF-DEFENSE")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.get_surveillance_self_defense()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("🔍 BROWSER PRIVACY TESTING")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.test_browser_privacy()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("🦡 PRIVACY BADGER PROTECTION")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.install_privacy_badger()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("🔒 SSL/TLS CERTIFICATES")
        print("=" * 50)
        self.setup_certbot()
        
        print("\n" + "=" * 50)
        print("📚 ADDITIONAL EFF RESOURCES")
        print("=" * 50)
        
        print("\n🔧 More FREE EFF Tools:")
        print("   • Crocodile Hunter - Detect fake cell towers")
        print("   • Encrypt the Web Report - HTTPS adoption tracking")
        print("   • Atlas of Surveillance - Police tech database")
        print("   • TOSBack - Terms of Service tracking")
        
        print("\n📖 EFF Campaigns:")
        print("   • Encrypt the Web")
        print("   • Fix It Already (security vulnerabilities)")
        print("   • Who Has Your Back? (corporate transparency)")
        print("   • Coders' Rights Project")
        
        print("\n💡 Privacy Action Items:")
        print("   1. Install Privacy Badger and HTTPS Everywhere")
        print("   2. Test browser privacy with Cover Your Tracks")
        print("   3. Review Surveillance Self-Defense guides")
        print("   4. Enable SSL/TLS on your websites")
        print("   5. Support EFF's digital rights work")
        
        print("\n📧 Stay Informed:")
        print("   • EFF Newsletter: https://www.eff.org/subscribe")
        print("   • Action Alerts: https://act.eff.org/")
        print("   • Deeplinks Blog: https://www.eff.org/deeplinks")
        
        return True

# Usage
toolkit = EFFPrivacyToolkit()
toolkit.generate_privacy_report()

name: Electronic Frontier Foundation Privacy

best_practices: Install Privacy Badger on all browsers
Test browser privacy with Cover Your Tracks
Use Certbot for free SSL certificates
Subscribe to EFF alerts for privacy news
common_use_cases: Browser privacy protection and tracking prevention
operational_guidance.recommended_update_frequency: Check monthly for tool updates, review guides quarterly
operational_guidance.value_proposition: Leading digital rights organization providing free, open source privacy tools and comprehensive security guides backed by decades of expertise

quality_metrics.accessibility: All resources freely available without registration
quality_metrics.completeness: Comprehensive coverage of digital privacy topics
quality_metrics.update_speed: Regular updates to tools and guides
